com.codecool.core.animation

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.core.AppObject
      • com.codecool.core.animation.Animation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bufferable, Renderable

    public abstract class Animation
extends AppObject
    Implements animation functionality by the defineFrames() so every class that extends it has to use the method to define frames which will represent the particular frames of the animation.

    There is two option for an animation to be played in the app. 1. when it plays from start to finish. 2. when it is looping.

    You can set it with isLooping at the instantiation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected char[][][] frames
      You can think of this as your sequence of pictures which will played when your Animation added to the app.

      • Fields inherited from class com.codecool.core.AppObject

        app, renderSymbols, tagName, xPos, yPos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(int xPos, int yPos, App app, boolean isLooping)
      Constructs an Animation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void defineFrames()
      This where the user of this class have to define frames
      void update()
      Goes through the frames, it is updating the frameCounter in every update, and when reaches the end acts based on isLooping and starts over, or removes the animation from the host app.

      • Methods inherited from class com.codecool.core.AppObject

        getBufferTag, getRenderData, getXPos, getYPos, setBufferTag

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • frames

        protected char[][][] frames
        You can think of this as your sequence of pictures which will played when your Animation added to the app.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(int xPos,
                 int yPos,
                 App app,
                 boolean isLooping)
        Constructs an Animation.
        Parameters:
        xPos - x coordinate of the Animation in the app.
        yPos - y coordinate of the Animation in the app.
        app - a reference of the host.
        isLooping - for determine if it is a looped animation or not.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Goes through the frames, it is updating the frameCounter in every update, and when reaches the end acts based on isLooping and starts over, or removes the animation from the host app.
        Overrides:
        update in class AppObject

      • defineFrames

        public abstract void defineFrames()
        This where the user of this class have to define frames

        It is done by defining a 3D character array which will represent the frames of the animation.
